14
15#ifndef IRS_CONTEXT_H
16#define IRS_CONTEXT_H 1
17
18/*! \file
19 *
20 * \brief
21 * The IRS context module provides an abstract interface to the DNS library
22 * with an application. An IRS context object initializes and holds various
23 * resources used in the DNS library.
24 */
25
26#include <dns/types.h>
27#include <irs/types.h>
28
29ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
30
31isc_result_t
32irs_context_create(irs_context_t **contextp);
33/*%<
34 * Create an IRS context. It internally initializes the ISC and DNS libraries
35 * (if not yet), creates a DNS client object and initializes the client using
36 * the configuration files parsed via the 'resconf' and 'dnsconf' IRS modules.
37 * Some of the internally initialized objects can be used by the application
38 * via irs_context_getxxx() functions (see below).
39 *
40 * Requires:
41 *
42 *\li contextp != NULL && *contextp == NULL.
43 */
44
45isc_result_t
46irs_context_get(irs_context_t **contextp);
47/*%<
48 * Return an IRS context for the calling thread. If no IRS context is
49 * associated to the thread, this function creates a new one by calling
50 * irs_context_create(), and associates it with the thread as a thread specific
51 * data value. This function is provided for standard libraries that are
52 * expected to be thread-safe but do not accept an appropriate IRS context
53 * as a library parameter, e.g., getaddrinfo().
54 *
55 * Requires:
56 *
57 *\li contextp != NULL && *contextp == NULL.
58 */
59
60void
61irs_context_destroy(irs_context_t **contextp);
62/*%<
63 * Destroy an IRS context.
64 *
65 * Requires:
66 *
67 *\li '*contextp' is a valid IRS context.
68 *
69 * Ensures:
70 *\li '*contextp' == NULL.
71 */
72
73isc_mem_t *
74irs_context_getmctx(irs_context_t *context);
75/*%<
76 * Return the memory context held in the context.
77 *
78 * Requires:
79 *
80 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
81 */
82
83isc_appctx_t *
84irs_context_getappctx(irs_context_t *context);
85/*%<
86 * Return the application context held in the context.
87 *
88 * Requires:
89 *
90 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
91 */
92
93isc_taskmgr_t *
94irs_context_gettaskmgr(irs_context_t *context);
95/*%<
96 * Return the task manager held in the context.
97 *
98 * Requires:
99 *
100 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
101 */
102
103isc_timermgr_t *
104irs_context_gettimermgr(irs_context_t *context);
105/*%<
106 * Return the timer manager held in the context.
107 *
108 * Requires:
109 *
110 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
111 */
112
113isc_task_t *
114irs_context_gettask(irs_context_t *context);
115/*%<
116 * Return the task object held in the context.
117 *
118 * Requires:
119 *
120 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
121 */
122
123dns_client_t *
124irs_context_getdnsclient(irs_context_t *context);
125/*%<
126 * Return the DNS client object held in the context.
127 *
128 * Requires:
129 *
130 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
131 */
132
133irs_resconf_t *
134irs_context_getresconf(irs_context_t *context);
135/*%<
136 * Return the resolver configuration object held in the context.
137 *
138 * Requires:
139 *
140 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
141 */
142
143irs_dnsconf_t *
144irs_context_getdnsconf(irs_context_t *context);
145/*%<
146 * Return the advanced DNS configuration object held in the context.
147 *
148 * Requires:
149 *
150 *\li 'context' is a valid IRS context.
151 */
152
153ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
154
155#endif /* IRS_CONTEXT_H */
156
